website_summaries.verdict: Well-crafted, ample-capacity bike bag is expandable with an unobtrusive front-to-back profile on bike, available in small, medium, or large sizes.
pros: Durably constructed from 1200 denier Cordura with PTFE (a non-stick synthetic fluoropolymer coating)
Traditional-style triple nylon with hook-and-loop straps to attach
Safety features include 3M reflective strip and place to attach rear light
cons: Large bag should only be used by taller or larger riders, as bottom of this bag attaches too far beneath the underside of seat and can rub on the tire

customer_reviews.title: Size Medium plenty of room well built ! See Picts.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased size MEDIUM. Perfect size for me as it has plenty of room for your gear and you can unzip it to expand its size a bit. It has 2 internal elastic bands to secure some items as well as an internal mesh elastic pouch on the inside of the flap you open, and one attachment point for the rear light. It also has 2 elastic bands to secure something on the bottom side. Overall well constructed. Seems pretty light weight for its heavy constructed material. Zippers are well built. I would buy it again. And for this price beats anything locally I could find in this size and construction/function.
customer_reviews.author: Nunya

customer_reviews.title: Totally Awesome Bike Bag! (Not too Big)
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the Topeak Large bag. Great quality and craftsmanship. Worth spending a little more! I do a side-by-side comparison between the Large and the Medium bags. Best bags that we have ever owned and yes, you can put an awful lot in them. See this video review to see how they look on the bikes and side by side. Hope the review helps!
customer_reviews.author: M. Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the bag for my gravel bike. Needed lots of storage for tubes, tools, etc. that you may need for a long ride in the middle of no where. Bag worked good for training (couple months) where I live in Indiana BUT didn't survive one Dirty Kanza 200 race. Road was very rough and the weight of items in the bag (1 tube, 1 multi-tool, 2 CO2, and 1 tire tool for plugs) proceed to rip open the seams at the top of the bag by the seat. Good storage but bag is not usable now.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Orth

customer_reviews.title: Lasted for only a month.
customer_reviews.text: I only had it for a little more than a month, and it's starting to tear on both sides where straps are attached. Return window is closed so will have to try Topeak customer service. Another problem with it is that on bumpy road/gravel buckles are loosening up and need to be adjusted after a short wile or the whole pack starts bouncing around. Update: Topeak US distributor/customer service (Todson) offered replacement, but only after I send ripped pack back to them, which means I have to buy another pack to use while they are working on it, and pay for shipment. I might as well just throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Micro: Very small but workable
customer_reviews.text: I got the micro and it's perfect for being small and staying out of the way. Some people will think it is too small for sure, but to be fair it is sized "micro." The construction seems good but I will post back if it doesn't hold up. For what it's worth I can fit what's in the picture: crank brothers 19 multi-tool in its case (1), threaded 16 gram CO2 (1), small inflater head (1), race 20 (700c) 60mm presta tube (1), nitrile glove (2), tire lever (2).
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Fits iPhone 8 Plus
customer_reviews.text: Not much to add to all the various and sundry reviews here already. Except to say, I can fit my iPhone 8 plus in mine. It sits atop an inner tube, tire levers, my multitool, some energy gels, and a backpacking towel (the size of a hackey sack). There's still tons of room, and that's with the expansion thing zipped closed. In fact, it's too large for my needs except that I need a place to stash my iPhone when I'm riding in street clothes instead of a jersey. Next phone I get is going to be smaller... these huge things are a pain to carry around.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L.

customer_reviews.title: Nice size bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice size bag and carries all of the things I need. I take along on a normal bike ride, Samsung 10+, wallet, keys, and a soft tool kit. Still enough room to add a spare tube. The strap on to the seat is a snug fit and the bag stays stationary and is solidly mounted. It is not so large as to be in the way but holds all you need. The one I got is the large unit.
customer_reviews.author: Big Mike

customer_reviews.title: the strap ripped right out of the packaging
customer_reviews.text: I went to remove the packaging from this to mount to bike and the Velcro strap seam ripped rendering it useless. I now have to locate a show repair place to recreate a better seam. I would not recommend this as its obviously constructed poorly.
customer_reviews.author: john scimeca

customer_reviews.title: Carries what I need
customer_reviews.text: I have cycled over 300,000 miles . This probably the best under the seat bag I have ever used. Well made:;very good zippers;easy to attach ;fits snugly,expands nicely and best of all it holds my rear flasher vertical. That means approaching cars see my tail light. And it’s not pointed at the ground or sagging. The medium bag carry’s tire irons, two tubes, CO2 inflatter,two extra CO2 cartridges, multi tool , patch kit and my keys
customer_reviews.author: eyetooth

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, just know that the large is very large indeed!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? This thing comes from the biggest saddle bag brand and is built well. I didn’t realize how large the large size would be, but here we are. I would have gotten a medium, since I don’t commute or travel on the bike, but it works. There is nothing wrong, I just got too large a size. THe bag is great. Mounts well, holds a bunch, and I figure it’ll last me pretty much forever!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Bag in Perfect Medium Size
customer_reviews.text: I researched several bike seat bags and am very pleased with this one. The medium size is the largest I would want to put under my MTB seat, but it easily fits the largest sized iPhone. I like the webbed pocket inside which holds a few credit cards and the outside loop to attach a tail light. It seems fairly waterproof, although it’s a bit tough to clean off mud from the rough canvas exterior.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Good, but......
customer_reviews.text: I got this bag in May, hung it on Specialized Body Geometry saddle, carrying two, 700cx28mm spare inner tubes, 2 small allen wrenches, 2 plastic tire tools, and cleat covers. Not a big load, But the material split on both sides of the top where the plastic support piece has worn through. See pictures. Does the bag still work? yes. Will it split more? I don't know. Maybe. Looks like a defective design. Contacted Topeak about this problem and they promptly sent me a replacement at no charge but I did have to pay to send the defective bag in.
customer_reviews.author: Max Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Small but fits everything you need
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for as small of a pack as I could to haul the necessaries on rides and this pack is perfect. Stores a 700c tube, CO2 cartridge, 3 levers, small multi-tool and phone (iPhone 11 Pro). Wouldn't fit a Pro Max sized phone with the other things, but not an issue for me. Easy install and would fit almost any saddle I'm guessing.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Great for Long Distance Touring
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag! Most importantly, it works very well with a Cane Creek Thudbuster Short Travel seatpost. (It'll probably work with the Long Travel, too.) Additionally, this bag is large enough to hold a big ol' tube for a 26x1.9 inch tire, a large bicycle multi tool, a patch kit and pressure gauge, a tire boot, and several spare parts like nuts & bolts, brake & derailleur cables (coiled), zip ties, etc. Bonus features include a retro-reflective strip a loop on the back for a tail light -- things I always appreciate.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Almost a must have for any bike
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two for our ebikes. Needed somewhere to carry some tissues for my wife, a tire repair kit, and tool kit. For that, these fit the bill perfectly. The install was quick and easy and the bags ride snug under the seats. Surprisingly, quite a bit of room inside one. Easily held the above items and could hold more. Zipper can be a pain to unzip given it's placement on top of the bag and how snug the bag rides under the seat. The small strap on top of the bag is great for clipping a bike light to.
customer_reviews.author: bluesy

customer_reviews.title: Overall good product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the small pack. I don't travel with much, but need a place for my keys and headphones. I've also been able to fit a pair of gloves inside, size L. The small is indeed SMALL, but suits my needs. If you need to carry a ton of stuff, size up! Haven't tested water resistance yet, but looks like it'll do fine. And you are able to clip an additional light to it, so that you don't lose a valuable spot for lights or a reflector. It's adjustable and can attach tightly; it doesn't move while I ride.
customer_reviews.author: RareForm

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy Expandable Pack
customer_reviews.text: All the tools fit nicely into the pack. I like that it sits sloped towards the seat tube rather than horizontal. When I open the rear hatch, my various tire repair tools, lights, etc. do not fall out. The small mesh envelope inside the hatch is convenient for securing a tail light when you don't want it on the pack. Of course, the convenient strap on the outside of the hatch makes it easy to attach that same tail light when you want it operational. Excellent quality, fits well on a road bike.
customer_reviews.author: Redmond Washington

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed with this purchase. After 2 months of normal use it's ripping apart at both seams where the straps are sewn to the bag. Got the medium size and always kept a multitool, spare tube, CO2, tire levers, and a patch kit in it. Looks like many others have had this problem too. Not sure how it can have such a high overall rating...
customer_reviews.author: Chris Ebner

customer_reviews.title: Good construction, truly bizarre design
customer_reviews.text: +Materials are very good, expansion panel is useful, very weather resistant -THE ZIPPER DESIGN. A single zipper pull that is very difficult to open due to how close the opening is to the bottom of your saddle. You end up having to have to nudge the zipper along with the tip of your finger, which obviously is not optimal. Other bags have a subtly different zipper position which alleviates this problem. Did anybody at Topeak actually try to use this bag?
customer_reviews.author: Elvis Incognito

customer_reviews.title: pretty good, but not amazing
customer_reviews.text: good: it's a good size and things stay pretty quiet inside. durable looks good the way the door opens is nice, like a mailbox the pouch on the door is nice bad it's hard to unzip when the zipper is right up top under the seat. the expando zipper is not really that great. i had a cheaper cloth bag for about 20 years and it had one smaller compartment on the outside that was just big enough for two CO2s, a lever, and a head. it was great. also, when there was less stuff in it you could squish it down. this bag doesn't squish.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS D LAMBERT

customer_reviews.title: Lrg and Medium Review
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Lrg and medium so i can def give a good opinion on size. The lrg is big enough for 2 inner tubes, a bog mini pump, tire levers, a multi tool, and your cell phone, or a couple clif bars. The medium is good for a group ride when you just want to bring 1 inner tube, a multitool. tire levers, unfortunatly no mini pump can fit the med.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great under the seat storage
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a second one of these for my wife's bike. They are great for holding tire repair supplies, tools, etc. My wife wanted one to carry personal items (wallet, phone, etc.). Good quality materials, easy installation, and they stay put while riding.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Mizell

customer_reviews.title: Seems Nice and Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: I have the medium and have expanded the zipper section. Can comfortably fit a spare tub and my large cable bike lock in it. Would still be space for more cramming but I want the lock to be easily accessible daily so not over doing it. No way to lock anything down so wouldn't really want anything in the bag that would be a target anyway. Zipper works smoothly. Will see how it holds up to almost daily commuting.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Hilt

customer_reviews.title: Great little saddle bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little saddle bag. I actually bought it for one bike, and when I got a new bike, I had to replace the saddle bag on that one with this one, I like it so much. It holds exactly what I need (a bike multi-tool, keys, etc. Nice and easy access, and I put a red tail light on it for visibility, which holds on nicely in exactly the right position. This one works best with the front strap wrapped around the seat post, which is unfortunate. I'd rather not have a strap around the seat post but it's not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: TheLizard

customer_reviews.title: Great all around saddle bag.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a size medium. I can fit quite a bit without the extender open: a spare tube, tool, front & rear lights, tire levers, CO2 inflator and a small bottle of lube with room to spare. Unzipping the extender adds a lot more room! The mounting system is easy to use and swap between bikes. I docked a single star because the velcro seat post strap is a little too big. My seatpost is 27.2mm and I had to modify the closure to be able to reliably secure it to my seatpost. Should work with most new larger posts, though.
customer_reviews.author: EZReviews

customer_reviews.title: strap tore off after a week
customer_reviews.text: Top holding strap tearing off and sides split after only a few rides. Bag was not overpacked, only had 2 inner tubes, tire lever, and patch kit. Not sure if I got a lemon, but very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: ms

customer_reviews.title: Started to fall apart after 3 rides!
customer_reviews.text: I've use a handfull of seat bags for mtb and road cycling since 1992, and they have always lasted at least several years - often much longer. This seat bag started to fall apart on my 3rd mtb ride with it... ripping where the top strap is attached to the bag. I don't have much in it, just a spare tube and tire levers. I've had good luck with other Topeak items, but will steer clear of their seat bags from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Martin

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I need and does all the little things right
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Topeak wedge pack, my first being 10+ years old. This one is Goldilocks, not too small, not too large, not too expensive, not too cheap, not too aero but aero enough to put on my endurance bike, which is mainly used for long distance rides where I need. a place to put my extra like tire repair kit, keys, ID's or spare change and the like. Excellent design and functionality win me over.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Bizzprof

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag, but...
customer_reviews.text: This bag had all the features i need from a trusted Brand. But not so, it did last a 100 mile gravel ride, as you can see from the picture, it started ripping on both side of the straps. It cannot be used anymore unless I want to loose the bag. i would not buy it again. Not even for my commute since the roads are not great.
customer_reviews.author: Santi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Saddle Bag
customer_reviews.text: I have the large Topeak bag for use with a mountain bike. The bag is very easy to attach or remove as necessary. The capacity of the bag is perfect for carrying a large cell phone, repair tools, keys and a wallet, without performing the expansion. Performing the expansion provides even more space. The heavy-duty nylon takes the weather well and is very easy to clean. The design fits well under the seat and does not protrude or encumber riding.
customer_reviews.author: Chamasazi

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought a cheap bag from a box store, but it often times would disconnect from my seat. Luckily I never lost my bag since it was also connected to my seat post. This bag is awesome. It has three straps to connect to the seat post. So it one did disconnect, you still have two other straps attached to the bike. I also like how the bag expands to carry extra items.
customer_reviews.author: W. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Just what you need under your saddle
customer_reviews.text: I have the medium. Its a perfect size to hold a spare tube, tire irons, C02 shooter and an iPhone. Its even expandable. Durable and attaches securely. Just what you need and nothing more. A good value.
customer_reviews.author: IDOC

customer_reviews.title: Good quality bag.
customer_reviews.text: I have the micro version. If you are buying the micro version you probably want something that doesn’t look too bulky on your bike and expect limited room and that is exactly what you get. Still I fit a road tube, tire levers, 2 co2 cartridges and a small mini tool. The Velcro that wraps around the seat post is removable, a nice feature since my bike has a large aero seat post. I was able to replace the strap with a longer one.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Shepardson Jr.

customer_reviews.title: durable and well-designed
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-made, well-designed under-seat bag. I do like how it is expandable, though I mostly keep it at its most reduced size (as seen in pic). Many things are well-though out about this bag, like the reflective stripe, internal compartments, and the loop for a red flasher. The only reason I don't give this bag 5 stars is because I don't like how the zipper goes across the top, where there is little room because the bag is pressed up against the underside of my bike seat. I wish it hinged at the top and zipped beneath the bag opening instead. I think this is a durable product and expect it will last for 10 years or more.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Best bike pouch I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Topeak medium pouch. It has a zipper for an option to go larger if I want. Easy to install, and has a very low- profile design. The price is right, and it holds everything I need. The medium comfortably holds two road tubes, two CO2 cartridges, a pair of tire irons, my CO2 inflator, small patch kit, and my Topeak tool kit. It still has room for something small...even before I expand it with the zipper. It doesn’t look bulky or look obscenely huge.
customer_reviews.author: MJO

customer_reviews.title: poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Stitching began ripping within a month (after only 2 to 4 uses). Design is not bad, but that doesn't do any good with such poor product quality. I've gotten so little use out of it that it still looks brand new other than the fact that the seems are coming apart. Sadly, I just noticed this and it's too late to return, otherwise I would ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Easy install
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my 29er MTB just road riding right now and wanted to be able to take my phone to track my workouts. I got the medium and my iPhone 8 Plus fits but just barely. You could stuff a few other things in there under it if they were small or weren’t rigid. It’s otherwise great. Maybe should’ve gotten the large but oh well
customer_reviews.author: Erik J.

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit under seat
customer_reviews.text: Large version has lots of space but the shape is such that it does not fit under the seat on my bike. The shape is just all wrong for this. Top should be curved to follow the shape from the horizontal part under the seat to the vertical part along the seat post. Instead the top is very rigid and very flat. The straps don't seem to match up well with the seat rails. Even though a seat pack with this much space is hard to find, unfortunately had to returned this one.
customer_reviews.author: diyfool

customer_reviews.title: It suits my needs
customer_reviews.text: Most people by these with the intent of keeping some bike tools on hand, maybe an extra inner tube. I use it to store PPE, it's my lifeline to the outside world during COVID, holds the PPE, and extra water bottle and some cash, just what I need to for the 5 to 10 mile rides that I engage. It's very sturdy, easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Diamond

customer_reviews.title: Great bike bag!
customer_reviews.text: The bag fit nicely under the seat and was easy to install. Plenty of room but not too big! I was able to fit a spare inner tube plus tire levers and a CO2 inflater with cartridge. I also fit in a pair of disposable gloves and an actually useful first aid kit with bandages, antibiotic cream, etc. The small strap on the back is perfect to clip on a rechargeable tail light. Great bike bag and just the right size for under the seat!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M.

customer_reviews.title: Both sides ripped where strap attaches to bag.
customer_reviews.text: Have had this bag for a month and both sides have ripped where the seat straps attach to bag. The bag was not filled with lead bars just a tire repair kit and spare tube.
customer_reviews.author: mark burton

customer_reviews.title: Fits the bare essentials
customer_reviews.text: I can get one 700c tube, three tire levers, one CO2 breaker, and two 12g CO2 cartridges in there. Other than some very small things like tube patches and money, there is no more space in this wedge. But it's perfect if you want something really small that fits only the essentials and you plan to carry everything else in your jersey pockets.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Had one for  years.... last one ripped in a week
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it was defective but loaded up the new bag with the same stuff that was in the old bag and within a week... no .. .maybe a couple of weeks... the back was torn at the top by the straps on both sides exposing the hard plastic insert on the top of the bag. Should have photographed it but tossed it in frustration. Generally Topeak products are good but this time they missed the mark.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good for the money bike pouch
customer_reviews.text: this may be a design feature, but I have a hard time getting in to the pouch when the straps are completely tightened. It definitely ensures nobody is going to "accidentally" sneak into my bag, but it also causes some difficulty for me when I do want to get in to it. I haven't figured out how to loosen the straps and zip it open from a seated, or even half off position. I have to get all the way off. Other than that, great pouch (I ordered medium, which fits my smartphone, a spare tube, and keys very well.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Lawlor

customer_reviews.title: My second one. Great build.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the exact same saddlebag a few years ago and it had no signs of wear. I never had any issues with it and it as a good quality product. I ended up losing it when I was cleaning my garage last year. I've been using my Camelbak to hold my spare tubes and patch kit, which is a huge pain. I finally got around to getting another one. My only regret is not replacing it sooner
customer_reviews.author: Cito

customer_reviews.title: Fits my 8 AH Battery!
customer_reviews.text: Other bags are tapered and this one fits my 3x4x6.5". I used an extra strap to secure it and it is perfect for me. great price and well built...
customer_reviews.author: JiGo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I just received it today. The light mount is not stitched in on one side. What happened to the QA?? Going by the many other reviews, and my previous experience with Topeak products, the should be a well made, quality product. I received a dud. I'll return for an exchange, just an inconvenient process...
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Bushnell

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: It is spacious, efficient, and you don't notice it while riding. It is exactly what it should be, and nothing else. It's great and I'm glad I bought it. Water resistance is good enough. I don't know why they asked about security features, this bag does not have any...
customer_reviews.author: Matts'zon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size for Road Bike Day Rides
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size bag for day road rides. Can carry a tube, CO2 canister, portable inflator (Genuine Innovations Air Chuck or BriskMore ), couple allan wrenches, old cotton sock rag, spoke wrench, keys. I just got this bag and not used it yet, but looks to be very tough.
customer_reviews.author: The Bird Man

customer_reviews.title: Topeak Wedges Small are a cyclist's choice!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these wedges to replace the micro versions that I have been purchasing for years, so I decided to give the larger size a go. These wedges are constructed of the same quality as the micro; in some aspects they may even appear to be a tad stronger. The capacity is enough to include the basics plus one's keys and even a smartphone. The micro is quite compact but limited in capacity. Overall they fit well on my Trek 2009-10 Madone 4.7 and 5.2 respectively, and I do recommend these for cyclists for both capacity and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Larry S. Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two larges. These are the third Topeak products that I have purchased. I replaced the one on my road bike for I am now carrying more gear and had to have more space. The original still is fine after twenty years but became too small. Great products and do last for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Thorosborn

customer_reviews.title: It comfortably fits a tube
customer_reviews.text: This bag is very durable. The zipper has not failed despite my overstuffing the bag. It comfortably fits a tube, tire levers, patch kit, and multitool. If I push it, I can fit in my minipump (a Blackburn airstik). I would go one size up (medium rather than small) next time.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: Medium to fit sport bikes
customer_reviews.text: Medium is a good fit for pro saddle. Large one is so much wider than a saddle, you can not pedal. MUST include dimensions! Thus 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for road bike - medium fits two spare inner tubes, multi-tool and more...
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend. Got the medium size. happy with that size - can fit in two spare inner tubes, tire irons, and a multi-tool with a little room to spare (can fit even more by undoing the zipper that expands the pack's capacity). Mesh pocket in inside of back flap good for money / credit card, etc. Durable. Easy to attach to the bike frame / easy to adjust. Back flap opens only to 45 degree angle, which is good so that things don't fall out of pack when open. Good, basic colors.
customer_reviews.author: kettlemanTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag is very large, almost too large as I needed to move my rear reflector to another spot on my bike. Despite the size and having to relocate my reflector I love the bag. I am able to fit the following items: 1) nexus 6 (phablet) 2) Vibrelli mini bike pump 3)My G DVD multi bike tool (almost the same size of phone) 4) Grenola bar 5) tire patch kit 6) Bike computer (when not in use) 7) id and money The extra fabric that is exposed when you expand the bag is pretty flmisy but I doubt I will need to use it due to the overall size. All in all, great bag.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice and is a pretty good value, but the zipper is annoyingly tough to use and the mesh pocket on the back flap tore my second time using this saddle bag (put my Topeak Mini18+ Multitool in there and it destroyed the mesh pocket). Would give 3.5 Stars if I could...
customer_reviews.author: D. Regan

customer_reviews.title: Quality bike pack
customer_reviews.text: Nice bike bag but the medium was too small. I could fit my phone and keys in it and a multi tool and thats about it. Go for the large size if you want to fit a spare tube. Pack unzips in the middle for more storeage, if you get the large and unzip it for max storage i was able to get a spare tube, multi tool, tire levers, and my phone and keys in it though it was a tight fit.
customer_reviews.author: .eagle fire

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pack for mountain or road bikes
customer_reviews.text: This pack is great. I have a medium size which fits all the tools needed to repair a flat or chain repair. Unzipping the side expands the length which is helpful. This is strapped to a 2020 specialized turbo levo mountain bike and it works fine even with the seat all the way down.
customer_reviews.author: SLB

customer_reviews.title: Better than many other types
customer_reviews.text: Better than many other types, enough room for 2 spares, several CO2 cartridges, inflator kit, and a couple of snack bars, without having to unzip the expansion zipper. Bought 2 of these. One had zipper malfunction a few years later where the zip does not zip. But after clamping down the rear portion of the zipping component, it was able to zip again - so far. Would be nice to have the strap on the back side a little higher for attaching red rearing warning light.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Topeak Medium wedge pack is just right for me.
customer_reviews.text: Topeak makes a well designed and well made wedge pack. This one will haul a spare tube, some tools, patch kit, tire levers and a couple thin energy bars. I'm not sure I'd go smaller unless you are really trying to shave ounces off your kit. I have a number of Topeak packs and bags and when I'm in the market for a new one I look for Topeak - I'm never disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: DonS

customer_reviews.title: Topeak Bike Bag Size Large
customer_reviews.text: Attractive, well made and durable bag, but I found the "large" size bag too wide at the point for comfortable use on my road bike. The clips on the two side straps each need to be adjusted in order to expand the bag. I retunred it simp;y because it was too wide at the pont and ultimately purchased a size medium with the snap lock feature.
customer_reviews.author: VNNCKC

customer_reviews.title: Just a great sized bag and seems well built.
customer_reviews.text: This is just an all-around nice bag...not for you folks that are looking to save a gram or two...I want to carry two tubes, levers, phone, wallet, CO2, multi-tool, etc and it all fits in there really well. I like the little mesh area at the front for my wallet...or whatever you think is most important. Loving it.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Black

customer_reviews.title: Great Item
customer_reviews.text: Just like its described, lots of room and the zipper looks like its been sewed on to last. Real easy to install, fits just fine under my seat. Just one thing thats pretty minor about the zipper, for awhile I was having trouble zipping it up all the way, had one area it was getting stuck at, but seems to be getting better with use. Havent tried it in the rain yet, but I usually plastic baggie all my stuff in wet weather anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ripped on the first ride.
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this on a ride, the fabric ripped near the top of the pouch. This is so highly rated, I exchanged it for the exact same product and assumed that it was an unlucky fluke of manufacturing. Unfortunately, the second one ripped on the exact same place. I now think that the seams on the top of the pouch are just poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah A Braafladt

customer_reviews.title: medium size was too big for me and rubbed my ...
customer_reviews.text: medium size was too big for me and rubbed my legs. I also did not appreciate one zipper without locks or ties. It is very well made though and very spacious. I have Trek FX 3 bike..
customer_reviews.author: Boriska

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking, well constructed, but unfortunate design. I bought the medium size and installed it close to the bottom of the bike seat, as shown in the pictures. Then I found that I can't zip and unzip the opening because it's too close to the bottom of the seat. I had to install it loose, hanging an inch or two below the seat, in order to use the zipper. Now it takes two hands to zip and unzip the opening and it doesn't seem very securely attached, swinging side to side too much for my preferences.
customer_reviews.author: Rand Beacham

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality but very small
customer_reviews.text: If you plan to put a tube, patch kit, and tire irons in here you're probably good to go. If you want to put a cell phone in and a small wallet you're probably good to go. If you want to put clothes or a bike lock in it's probably too small for you.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Decent Size Saddle Bag
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased some other under-the-seat saddle bags and instantly returned them. I was amazed at how small some those things can be. What can you possibly put in things that small. I ordered this one because it came in some different sizes. I also saw some of these at a local REI so I was able to inspect the quality of them too. Can definitely store more items in here than the others. Material looks nice and heavy and looks well put together. Topeak seems to be a respectable brand and I have bought some other Topeak items for my biking please too.
customer_reviews.author: Troy L Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for the bucks
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect size (med) to pack all my gear in. Not too big and not too small. Fits a spare tube, a couple CO2 cartridges a multi tool, a repair kit and Allen wrenches. I like the webbed pocket on the flap to hold my wallet in the front so I don’t have to go searching for it after the ride. I found similar packs in local bike shops for $40 or more.
customer_reviews.author: Mugsy

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install and I was able to add a red light clip to the strap on the back flap. I've used it 5 times so far and have no issues with it yet. I'm just a little cautious because the bags I've used in the past always seemed to develop problems with their zippers. No issues with the zipper so far. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary G.

customer_reviews.title: The best bag on the planet
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a great bag. I wanted something small and yet able to hold all I need out on the road. As you can see n the pics it holds the same incredible crank bros multi-tool, a spare tube, a micro pump, a patch kit, two tire levers and a spare tube. Booyah. What you see is the size small bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Fits my wallet and iPhone just fine
customer_reviews.text: Seems well made. I bought the medium, and it holds my wallet, iPhone 11 Pro, key and a multi tool and patch kit without having to use the extension. Extending it opens up space obviously but not enough for a spare tube on top of everything else, would have to ditch my wallet and phone. Straps that hang are annoying, so wrap more around the seat rails. Not bad for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Very nice. Very durable
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Very durable. maybe I have it installed incorrectly, but when I have had to expand the pack by up zipping for the extra length; the hanging straps interfere and make it difficult to use this feature. The front of pack is quite narrow. Aerodynamic? Yes, but it makes it hard to put cliff bars, cube shots, (longer items) because they bunch up. Not complaining just stating what I would have liked to know prior to purchasing. Would I buy again? YES! I like how it tightly fits up under my seat. Very aerodynamic as indicated in earlier statement.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: A mixed bag
customer_reviews.text: The shape of this seat bag makes is easy to carry a lot of stuff in it (tools, energy bags, etc.). However, the side straps that secure it to the seat rails are constantly loosening as a result of normal road vibration. It is as if the manufacturer never took it out for a ride to test it out. Of course, you can tie the ends of the straps into knots to prevent this, but then it becomes a pain to remove the seat bag. There must be some sort of strap buckle they could have used that would have provided more slippage resistance. Were it not for that problem, I would rate it a "5".
customer_reviews.author: EWG

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for about a week. The only negative is that the zipper travels up and around the back, and my fingers struggle to open it as it goes along the top, right under the seat. But it works well otherwise, looks great, and seems to be very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: This bag is the best under seat bag
customer_reviews.text: I got the large bag. This bag is the best under seat bag I've seen. I have a couple of other seat bags that are smaller and work well, but I needed something larger. This bag just happens to be the perfect size. It fits like it was designed for my bike seat. It has enough room below the seat post strap to mount my clip-on fender with no problem. The nexus clips look like they are high quality, and the rest of the bag looks very well made. The rear mount for the tail light is well stitched and strong. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shop Bot

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag
customer_reviews.text: I got a new Trek Verbe 3 bike this bag fits perfect under my seat. It the perfect size for a tube, bike lock and wipes. There out of the way and always there if I need them. The bag has clasps that tighten instead of just Velcro. That keeps tight up against my seat and keeps it from rattling or moving. Love the Topeak bags they make a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag
customer_reviews.text: I've bought two of these and then went and cheaped out to save 5 bucks and bought a different brand for my third bike. I'm now in the process of buying another one of these to replace the cheap one. This bag is worth the money and will hold a lot of bike stuff during rides. Most importantly (to me at least) the straps that attach the bag to the bike seat hold it nice and tight so there is little to no movement of the bag during riding. I ride in Arizona so can't speak to its water resistance.
customer_reviews.author: Marc N.

customer_reviews.title: Good - but...
customer_reviews.text: Nice well built bag, but unfortunately the straps and zipper are not as good as the bag itself. I use mine strictly for mountain biking having for less than a year and a half and about 1,600 miles of riding. One of the straps broke once but my wife was able to sew it back together. Last night though when trying to get into it the zipper came apart. After some work with a screwdriver and pliers I was able to get it functioning again but I don't expect it to last long. Will probably buy another one though because it fits everything I need on the trail, is water proof and tucks nicely under the seat.
customer_reviews.author: fast

customer_reviews.title: Just OK.  Doesnt work as well as it should
customer_reviews.text: Good: Sturdy build. Good strap down system. Bad: In spite of what appears like a lot of room, nothing seems to fit without pushing and pulling. Larger items get caught on internal creases in the design. Closure system is one zipper witch doesn't work well because when seat is cinched up to the bottom of saddle it interferes with opening it. Also the closure system allows contents to fall out when opened. Few Internal Pockets. Verdfict: Just OK. Not Good. Used for 3 months. NOT A FAN
customer_reviews.author: STFAM

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and size
customer_reviews.text: I love this back. Fits under my trek seat. Tons of room in the bag. Has a zipper to expand. I got my spare type still in the box, tools, and air cartridges in it. My tail light can clip right to the bag.
customer_reviews.author: rockstar

customer_reviews.title: Great Size for the Essentials - Non-intrusive
customer_reviews.text: I've never carried anything on my road bike before, however I was finally convinced to carry an emergency repair kit as I often ride alone. This pack is very non-intrusive and hold everything I need for flat repair. I carry 2 tubes, 2 tire levers (pedros), and normally an emergency snack and a multi tool. I've put sunglasses in here when needed, and the option to expand it an inch or so has definitely come in handy. It is very stable and does not flop around.
customer_reviews.author: nnamssorxela

customer_reviews.title: Great bike bag with large capacity
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd similar bag because I wear many layers in the morning and need storage as the bike ride progress. It's very secured and can story A LOT of stuff! Highly recommended if you need tons of storage ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Emergency and Disaster Preparedness Guide

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for dedicated rdiers.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to carry my accessories when I went on long bike rides. It fits perfectly under the rear of the seat with no adjustments needed. Don't let the picture fool you, this thing is pretty roomy. I fit my keys, wallet, phone, extra tube, and multi-tool inside and there is still room. Whilst I don't think it's water proof, you could always keep a plastic bag inside of it to store any of your sensitive goods in case it starts to rain while you're out on a ride. I would definitely recommend this product if you like to ride and need something to hold all your essentials (wallet, keys, phone, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M. Geist

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you expect
customer_reviews.text: Great material, well made and sturdy. I haven’t put my materials in it yet, so I’ll be updating my review once I take it out and the pack is full of items. The only part I didn’t like is the strap that goes around the seat bar. When pulled tight, it barely connects to the velcro. I had to be creative and pull it around to the other side. Overall, it’s such a nice little pack.
customer_reviews.author: Ariela

customer_reviews.title: This is the one you want....
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with is wedge pack. I was concerned it would be too small, but it is huge! It doesn't bulge out on the sides either. I wanted it to fit a big 'ol Kryptonite bike chain in. Not only does it fit, but I still have room for my phone, wallet, keys and sunglasses case with room to spare... and that is before I even expand it!!! Yes it expands an extra inch or 2 if needed. Seems to be very well made. Fits well on my little fold up bike. My feet don't hit pouch while pedaling. Totally stoked with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Dewey

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike Bag for Tooling Around Locally
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag. It was really easy to mount which means if you stop somewhere it will be easy to take off and carry with you. It's got way more room than I thought. I can get my wallet, phone, security chain, garage door opener and there's still room!!
customer_reviews.author: DJZB

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I got the large size to hold an extra inner tube and compact bicycle tool for my fitness/town bike so I didn't have to wear a backpack. Works awesome can't speak to water resistance but everything else is great
customer_reviews.author: freddy

customer_reviews.title: The pack is the perfect size for me
customer_reviews.text: The pack is the perfect size for me. It holds everything that I need to change a tire, along with keys, and a small snack. The profile is perfect, it fits perfect under my seat and you can't tell how large it is by looking at it. I have seen some that are nice for carrying a lot of tools but they don't provide a clean look like this one does.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pouch
customer_reviews.text: Works well for its intended use. Very glad I bought the large size. Fit was just right on a 18" Trek Verve 2 700c with the seat raised about 1 3/8 inches. If the seat were not raised the fit would be pretty tight.
customer_reviews.author: SEM

customer_reviews.title: Debating between large or medium?
customer_reviews.text: I went with the medium thinking it would be enough for what i carry on rides. It was. I am able to bring: -16 in 1 toolkit (which is about the size of 2 decks of cards put together) -A portable hand-pump -A tire repair kit (about 12 assorted tire patches, small tube of rubber cement, rasp, and a couple of tire wrenches) -I also have a bone wrench that goes from 6-15mm -I was also able to fit my smartphone in the pouch. A suggestion would be to spray the pouch with a waterproof spray (i got some from walmart for 5$). I sprayed my pouch twice and it repels water like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca W.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: It is a perfect size to fit a 18650 3S2P and 26650 3S battery packs that I built for my bicycle lights. I placed it on the shock portion of my Gocycle G3 allowing a clean look. Its perfect
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Antoun

customer_reviews.title: Great seat bage
customer_reviews.text: Topeak makes some of the highest quality accessories on the market and this wedge seat bag is no exception. Love the size. I can fit tire levers a patch kit spare tube and my cell phone.
customer_reviews.author: David Kathy Carr

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it! Very sleek and form fitting
customer_reviews.text: Very form fitting and big enough to hold two tubes, a multi tool, tire levers, iPhone 6+ my wallet and car keys. You can also attach a light to it! I use my bike as a hybrid for commuting and for exercise so it's a little big for cycling but it works for me. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Tylor

customer_reviews.title: easy to install and can be swapped between bikes in ...
customer_reviews.text: This bag rocks. The medium size fits well under the seat and has plenty of room for your basic roadside repair tools and a tube. It is well made, easy to install and can be swapped between bikes in seconds. I am very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell J. Lamouria

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike Bag!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the Topeak Medium Bike bag. Great quality and craftsmanship. Worth spending a little more! We own both the medium size and the large size bags. I do a side-by-side comparison between the Large and the Medium bags. Best bags that we have ever owned and yes, you can put an awful lot in them. See this video review to see how they look on the bikes and side by side. Hope the review helps!
customer_reviews.author: M. Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Solid bag. Does it’s job.
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. Installs easier and solidly under seat. I think I should have gone one size large though. It’s pretty tight and does t fit my pump, which is a bummer. But I will just throw a CO2 pump in instead.
customer_reviews.author: BHX

customer_reviews.title: Works well....
customer_reviews.text: The bag works well, but be aware.... My seat lowers and when it does, the bag rubs against the rear tire. But other than that, I like how much the bag holds and the location of it's opening.
customer_reviews.author: S. Newland

customer_reviews.title: Lots of storage capacity, tucked away
customer_reviews.text: Mounts onto my bike quite snugly, with no movement. Has more storage than I expected, perfect for tire repair kit and a couple protein squeezes, and you can throw a wallet and phone in there as well. No conflict with pedaling motion.
customer_reviews.author: M_B

customer_reviews.title: A good compromise
customer_reviews.text: The micro is a good compromise in terms storage vs. obtrusion. I fit the following in it: 1. Tube 2. CO2 inflator 3. CO2 cartridge (Which are the worst offenders in terms of bulk, weight and pointyness) And the rest in my jersey pockets: 1. Tire levers 2. Keys 3. Phone 4. Credit card It's also very easy to attach and remove. I wouldn't want anything smaller or larger than this.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

product_meta.title: Topeak Aero Wedge Velcro Pack
product_meta.description: Traditional triple nylon/Velcro strap mount with snap-buckles . Made from 1200 denier Cordura with PTFE coating. 3M reflective strip and rear light attachment location.
feature_bullets: Pack is convenient gear-toting solution that clips instantly to the back of your bike's saddle and seat post
Constructed of rugged 1,200-denier Cordura material with DuPont coating for weather resistance
Pack attaches with Velcro strap mount and snap-on buckles
Large main opening offers room for essential road gear; 3M reflective strip and rear light attachment offer safety-minded touches
130-gram (0.29-pound) weight; 60-to-80-cubic-inch capacity; measures 4.1-by-4.7-by-7.9 inches (W x H x D)

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
